intro: Anigozanthos preissii var. plumosus, commonly known as the Christmas bush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking red and orange floral spikes. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The variety plumosus is distinguished by its fluffy, feathery appearance, which enhances its visual appeal.
